storyInfo: After night lifts, the Sarkaz army enters Londinium.

attributes.content: Several hours later...
Ralph—where's Ralph gone?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Oh, heaven's sakes! Everything's a mess—how can he still be running about?!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Miss Molly, Ralph said grown-ups keep mentioning artillery but he's never seen it for himself...
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: Of all the...! He can't have gone out in the street?!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: They've started firing out there already! The bolts and the shells flying all over—
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I'll go and find him.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Lady Golding! It's far too dangerous!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Ralph!
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Come here, now—
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: *sob* Lady Golding...
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Don't fear. Good boy. I'm right here.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Waah!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Let's hurry back—it'll all be better then, it'll all be alright.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Lady Golding! Ralph! You're back, oh, wonderful!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Miss Molly.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Oh, you scared me to death, Ralph.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Are all the children here, then?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am, I've counted.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: A—About just now...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: ...A shell landed nearby.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: What ever for? Just who exactly is warring with who?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: It doesn't make sense. Everything was fine this morning. How could this have happened to Londinium so suddenly?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Don't cry, Molly. No tears in front of the children.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Hold my hand tight. At least we're all together.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: We... we have the Defense Forces, and the Steam Knights!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: They'll protect Londinium. They'll protect Victoria!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The Steam Knights...
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: I think I just saw them! Are they the really tall ones, in all black and...
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: It was a shadow from a streetlamp, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: Liar! It was definitely one of the Steam Knights!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Tom the cobbler always goes on about them! He says how they're the symbol of Victoria's grandness!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: 'Hie over the valleys and over the rivers, rumble-ye-rumble, tell us the sound! Shalln't be thunder and shalln't be gale, the grand knights of grandest Victoria crowned!'
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: I knew that song when I was little too.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: My singing teacher said that every year on the King's birthday, everyone'd gather in the Square to catch a glimpse of all the Steam Knights in formation.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Can a Steam Knight really fly?
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Apparently, all they do is run very fast, faster than any lightning or storm. With all the steam they emit on top, they must look like they're stepping on clouds.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: This is pants. We don't even have a king now. I've never seen a parade once.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Also, they told me their teacher once saw something even greater.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: It was the year Victoria had just defeated Gaul, and to celebrate the then-King's birthday, dozens of Steam Knights all returned to Londinium together.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Their suits were draped in flags of Victoria, and once they'd all marched down the steps on the Palace of Westhaleg, it was like one giant flag all at once—
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: And then, everyone heard a howl even clearer than thunder.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: A howl?
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Yes, a howl. The people who were there say it was Victoria's emblem, the symbol on our flag, coming alive.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Because ever since that day, Victoria had officially surmounted Gaul, and become the grandest nation of all Terra's lands.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I'm so sorry, Lady Golding! Your father was Gaulish, I forgot...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: You needn't apologize to me, Molly. You and I, Ralph, and the hundreds of thousands of children that grew up here... all grew as Londiniers.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Perhaps the same goes for the one in the suit of steam armor outside.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Do you know a Steam Knight, Miss Golding?
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: ...Charles Lynch.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: He used to live in Auchterigg. Tom the cobbler was an old friend of his, hence why he loves to tell tales of His Majesty and the Steam Knights so much.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: In fact, Lynch was the last Steam Knight His Majesty ever titled in his life.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: And the last Steam Knight titled up till now.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.text: For so long that the children hear every tale of the Steam Knights told in Londinium, and first light has just broken.

The sound of artillery stops sooner than they expected. Past the witching hour, the streets outside have more or less returned to silence. But no words are needed as they all continue to stay huddled indoors. No one dares rush to see the state out there.
Near to every Londinier has been awake the whole night.
The same question circles in everyone's minds—come next morning, will Londinium be different?

attributes.content: The next day...
Seems like everything's the same... Where have the Duke's men gone?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I knew it. I knew the situation would come under control lickety-split once the Steam Knights showed up!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I just didn't think it'd be this fast...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Molly... some way or another, we're going to need to buy essentials.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: We don't know what might happen next.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: You two! What are you doing out here?!
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: Mr. Adams!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Excellent. For the children, knowledge is just as indispensable.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: ...Especially under present circumstances.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Mr. Adams, could you bring me those sets of plays from yesterday? And I'm afraid I'll need a few more too...
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Hmm. These fairytales, along with those first steps into mathematics and physics there, and a copy of the Home Medical Guide. If you could parcel all that, please...
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Wait, what's that noise?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: From not far away sound uniform footsteps.
They're unlike those the Londiniers have heard at parades. These are heavier, and more urgent.
The Palace of Westhaleg. The Shard. Parliament Square.
One flight after another in seamless succession, through Auchterigg's almost desolate streets, through the center of Londinium, Victoria's heart.
As the footsteps press towards this most ordinary of streets, some of those ducked to the side of the street finally catch clear sight of the advancing army—
Or better said, they see clearly the soldiers' appearances.
The horns, each shape their own, all condensed in ominous black, not even the rushing yawn of daylight casting a shine on them.
...Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: They're Sarkaz mercenaries.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: If they are mercenaries, I assume they'll leave soon.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: And then Londinium will be back to the way it was, won't it?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.text: They don't know it yet, but in the years to come, many a thing will change completely.
For one, the Sarkaz army won't ever leave Londinium.
From that day forth, no one will ever see steam armor in her streets again.
